abstract.p: Lois Erwin letter says ballistic fingerprinting works, but will not be accepted by Bush administration that prefers to call for studies and re-studies (S)

block.p: In ''A Way to Trace Bullets'' (editorial, Oct. 17), you point out that President Bush ''needs to lead'' on the issue of creating a ''computerized national system for tracing bullets and cartridge casings to the guns that fired them.''

In ''A Way to Trace Bullets'' (editorial, Oct. 17), you point out that President Bush ''needs to lead'' on the issue of creating a ''computerized national system for tracing bullets and cartridge casings to the guns that fired them.''
You're right, but he won't do it.

Mr. Bush says there needs to be a study first, even though the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms stated that ''numerous violent crimes involving firearms have been solved through use of the system.''

How many re-studies are already in the Bush pipeline? Mainstream scientists concluded long ago that global warming was a reality, but that was not good enough for the Bush team; they must study it again.
And so it will go with ballistic fingerprinting. It works, but that is not proof enough for Mr. Bush.
